page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT AROUND HINXWORTH
page.content: Not so long ago the majority of people who lived here also worked here either on the land or in the shops that used to exist.With increasing mechanisation those so employed dwindled drastically and thus those now living in the village are mostly professionals working outside the immediate area.The few who do work here tend to be self- employed owing to the unemployment situation or because it suits them to work from home.These are mostly people involved in the arts in some way - local craftsmen,artists,sculptors, musicians; or builders,farm managers and workers. The community is not yet too affected by the unemployment in the rest of the country; but there is no industry and local traders find life harder every year. Hence this is a commuter zone with more than 60% working in excess of 5 miles away.
